page.title: 06PUMPING STATIONS
page.content: In 1948 Low Worsall 1 was built to supply the needs of the ICI chemical and British Steel industries. Industry on Teesside developed greatly. They thought that they should build another pumping station as they needed more water. Low Worsall 2 was finished in 1981 being 60 feet deep,the pipes are 48 inches in depth and it only needs one man to pop in for ten minutes daily. The machinery is run automatically with a radio link to Thornaby office. When Low Worsall was built they found the remains of the old port. They built the station very deep so that they could keep going even when the river was at low tide. The old station can be used if necessary.Twenty three million gallons a day of non potable water is pumped from Low Worsall 2 to the industries on Teesside.
